skill.name: manager-planner
skill.description: Orchestrates Pukaist agents, enforces plan-first workflow, runs integrity tests, and delegates tasks; use for coordination or system audits.
skill.summary: Orchestrates Pukaist agents, enforces plan-first workflow, runs integrity tests, and delegates tasks...
skill.author: ACSKamloops

security_audit.summary: Prompt-based orchestration skill with no executable code. References internal Python scripts for system health checks, but these are part of the managed system's own tooling. No network calls, credential access, or suspicious behavior detected. Legitimate agent coordination tool.

low_findings.title: External command execution references
low_findings.description: The skill instructs agents to run Python scripts for system integrity checks. These include: 'python 99_Working_Files/Utilities/run_system_tests.py' (line 42), 'python 99_Working_Files/Utilities/repo_health_check.py' (line 47), and cleanup operations (line 49). These are legitimate internal system commands used for maintaining workflow integrity.

low_findings.title: Filesystem access for system audits
low_findings.description: The skill requires reading various system files for health checks and log consistency verification. Access includes: 'Agent_Communication_Log.md' (line 52), 'Review_Log.tsv' (lines 69-71), 'Flagged_Tasks.tsv' (line 75), and queue files in '99_Working_Files/Queues/' (lines 73-76). This is standard system auditing behavior.

content.value_statement: Multi-agent systems can become chaotic without coordination. This skill enforces plan-first workflows, runs automated integrity tests, and delegates tasks to specialized agents for systematic project execution.
actual_capabilities: Orchestrates specialized agents (Gatekeeper, Analyst, Scribe, Archivist, Historian, Barrister)
Enforces plan-first workflow with mandatory user approval before execution
Runs system integrity tests and health checks to validate environment stability
Validates output quality against defined standards (neutral voice, verbatim citations)
Performs deep system audits including log consistency and queue health checks
Manages task delegation and tracks completion through status codes
limitations: Cannot execute tasks without user-approved plans - requires manual approval at each stage
Depends on existing system structure (Index, Records, Queues, Logs) to function properly
Cannot operate without the supporting agent roster defined in the Pukaist system
Only operates within designated workspace directories and their internal tools

use_cases.title: Coordinate multi-agent tasks
use_cases.description: Delegate complex projects across specialized agents while maintaining oversight and quality control.

use_cases.title: Run system health audits
use_cases.description: Validate system integrity, check for orphaned files, stalled tasks, and queue health issues.

use_cases.title: Enforce output standards
use_cases.description: Ensure all agent outputs meet quality standards including neutral voice and proper citations.

prompt_templates.title: Quick system check
prompt_templates.prompt: Run the integrity tests and health check to confirm the system is stable. Report any issues found.

prompt_templates.title: Start new project
prompt_templates.prompt: Assess the current state, draft a step-by-step plan for [TASK], and present it for approval before delegating.

prompt_templates.title: Deep system audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a full system audit: check log consistency, queue health, output validation, and communication patterns. Report all findings.

prompt_templates.title: Approve pending work
prompt_templates.prompt: Review items in ManagerReview status. Perform second-pass verification and run manager-approve for completed items.

output_examples.input: Run a system health check and tell me if everything is working correctly.
output: âœ“ Integrity tests: All tests passed (OK)
âœ“ Health check: Root directory is clean, no temporary files
âœ“ Log consistency: Zero orphans, all files logged
âœ“ Queue health: No stalled tasks detected
System status: HEALTHY - All systems operating as intended

best_practices: Always wait for user approval before delegating tasks - never bypass the plan-first workflow
Run integrity tests before starting any major operation to ensure system stability
Use deep sampling (inspect multiple output files) rather than relying on single samples for quality checks
anti_patterns: Skipping plan approval and immediately executing tasks
Running cleanup without verifying the system is stable first
Delegating without checking the Agent Communication Log for context

faq.question: What tools does this skill work with?
faq.answer: Fully compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Uses native collaboration tools when available.

faq.question: How long can plans become?
faq.answer: Plans can be as detailed as needed. Use atomic steps and present clearly for user approval.

faq.question: Can this skill integrate with other agents?
faq.answer: Yes. When Codex multi-agent tools are available, this skill uses them for role delegation per system documentation.

faq.question: Is my data safe with this skill?
faq.answer: This skill only accesses its own workspace directories. No external data collection or network calls occur.

faq.question: What if tests fail during operation?
faq.answer: The skill will STOP and report the error. Fix the code before proceeding - no bypass available.

faq.question: How is this different from standard prompting?
faq.answer: This skill enforces governance: mandatory planning, testing, and quality gates before any action executes.
